e0a60f17-2162-4e51-80b1-39a0324783a4.description: Earning this badge indicates basic-level professional skills supporting leadership and collegiality in a diverse workplace. Badge earners can communicate complex information effectively to a broad audience and understand the value of presenting and publishing original work. They respect personal and professional ethics, integrity, and quality mentorship. They understand business and dining etiquette and are prepared for formal and informal parts of a job interview.
e0a60f17-2162-4e51-80b1-39a0324783a4.name: Professional Development (Professionals in Preparation) Foundational-Level

issuer.summary: issued by The University of Southern Mississippi

badge_template_activities.title: Develop the skill to explain the significance of complex research to a general audience by participating in USM's annual Three Minute Thesis competition.
Learn mentorship skills by participating in faculty-led analysis of realistic case studies describing graduate student and mentor interactions.
Create and present a poster style research presentation or oral presentation at the graduate research symposium, competently explaining the project and answering questions for a broad audience.
Attend a two-semester series of workshops and seminars addressing topics in academic integrity, career building, job searches, leadership, voice training, and the publication of scholarly works.

Complete an individual development plan to assess personal strengths and weaknesses, explore career options, set professional goals, design strategies to strengthen areas of weakness, and track progress.
Learn business and dining etiquette skills and expectations for business and academic interviews.

2cf80e69-ee4d-452d-88ff-ea85491034d3.description: Pathway Experience Preparation (PEP) is an online, non-credit 8-week professional development program designed to allow students to learn about opportunities within their field of study, and how to apply career competency knowledge to get the most out of their experience.
2cf80e69-ee4d-452d-88ff-ea85491034d3.name: Pathway Experience Preparation

issuer.summary: issued by The University of Southern Mississippi

badge_template_activities.title: Learn about different pathways within their major by researching online university tools and reflecting on their research through a written submission
Learn how to conduct basic company research and prepare for experiences by using guided questions and applying the knowledge gained to find ideal opportunities
Engage in a virtual or in person networking event.
Develop a starter resume after watching a resume workshop video from the university Career Services office
Learn about the 8 career competencies from the National Association of Colleges and Employers (NACE) and complete written exercises that show understanding of each competency.
Create a starter/projected portfolio that includes materials students can currently include or should be able to include from classes or experience.

3f504882-72c8-4ad8-895d-ee5c4cd82c8b.description: The Digital Humanities (DH) Proficiency Badge documents mastery of fundamental Digital Humanities skills and participation as a scholarly contributor in a major faculty DH research project. The DH badge is earned after successful completion of two- 3 hour courses: HUM 501 "Introduction to the Digital Humanities" and HUM 502 "Digital Humanities Practicum."
3f504882-72c8-4ad8-895d-ee5c4cd82c8b.name: Digital Humanities

issuer.summary: issued by The University of Southern Mississippi

badge_template_activities.title: Enhanced ability to apply computational tools to humanities analysis and interpretation; the ability to analyze and explain methodological approaches behind Digital Humanities scholarship; and the ability to engage with and contribute to current theoretical debates in Digital Humanities.

Expertise in working with and innovating alongside collaborative, interdisciplinary teams; mastery of new investigative methods and tools to advance and expand existing area(s) of specialization; ability to direct non-experts to key digital methodologies and tools to advance learning and engage diverse audiences through digital humanities technologies.
Mastery of skills in combining quantitative and qualitative research to advance a scholarly argument; demonstrated ability to adapt to technological advances in field(s) of expertise.
Mastery of data analysis, visualization, and exhibit software, tools, and technology appropriate for conveying digital humanities content.

skills.name: Relationship Building Through In-person And Digital Human Connection

e76bc0e5-3f84-4a92-9b1b-454d7113e93e.description: Professional nurses (i.e., BSN, MSN, or PhD) require knowledge and skills for future nurse educator roles and to meet continuing education needs. The Nursing Education (NE) Proficiency Badge demonstrates expertise in curriculum development, teaching and learning strategies, quality course development, evaluation and test interpretation, and the faculty role. The NE Badge is earned after successfully completing three required 3-credit NE courses from a prescribed list of courses.
e76bc0e5-3f84-4a92-9b1b-454d7113e93e.name: Nursing Education

issuer.summary: issued by The University of Southern Mississippi

badge_template_activities.title: Completed three, 3-credit nursing education courses earning a B or better in each of the following courses: 1) NUR 610-Assessment and Evaluation in Nursing Education, 2) NUR 611-Curriculum and Teaching in Nursing, and 3) NUR 678-Role in Teaching.
Developed enhanced ability to develop and revise nursing curricular for an undergraduate nursing program.m.
Mastered skills for developing syllabi for curriculum courses.
Mastered skills for developing a teaching plan and evaluating teaching-learning strategies.
Mastered skills for developing a test blueprint of a topic or module, and accurately interpreting testing scores.
Developed advanced ability to discuss the role of the academic nurse educator in teaching, scholarship, service, and collegiality.

3cd15b22-1acc-4125-832a-325f4c73cb54.description: Nurse leaders (i.e., BSN or MSN) require knowledge and skills in managing and leading in healthcare or academic environments. The Nursing Leadership (NL) Proficiency Badge demonstrates expertise in quality improvement and financial management of healthcare-related outcomes. The NL Badge is earned after successfully completing two graduate-level nursing leadership courses from a prescribed list of courses.
3cd15b22-1acc-4125-832a-325f4c73cb54.name: Nursing Leadership

issuer.summary: issued by The University of Southern Mississippi

badge_template_activities.title: • Completed two nursing leadership courses (total of 7 credit hours) with a B or better in each of the following courses: 1) NUR 817-Quality and Leadership in Healthcare Systems (4 credit hours), and 2) NUR 819-Economic and Finance in Healthcare Systems (3 credit hours).
Developed advanced skills in leadership, management skills, and application of strategies for managing healthcare delivery in organizations.
Developed advanced ability to recognize changes in organizations that impact performance and outcomes.
Mastered skills for planning fiscal management in organizations.
